sections.heading: What is 〜てから (te-kara)?
sections.content:
〜てから means "after doing (something)." It connects two actions in sequence, showing that the first action is completed before the second one begins.

[Verb te-form] + から 食べてから "after eating" 見てから "after seeing/watching"

children.heading: Basic Pattern
children.content: Verb (te-form) + から 勉強してから "after studying" 帰ってから "after returning/going home" 読んでから "after reading"

children.heading: Sequential Actions
children.content:
Shows clear sequence: Action 1 → Completion → Action 2

宿題をしてから、遊びます "After doing homework, I'll play" ご飯を食べてから、出かけます "After eating, I'll go out" シャワーを浴びてから、寝ます "After taking a shower, I'll sleep"

children.heading: Daily Routines
children.content: 朝ごはんを食べてから、学校に行く "After eating breakfast, I go to school" 歯を磨いてから、寝る "After brushing teeth, I sleep" 手を洗ってから、食べます "After washing hands, I eat"

children.heading: Past Actions
children.content: 映画を見てから、レストランに行った "After watching a movie, we went to a restaurant" 日本に来てから、3年になる "It's been 3 years since I came to Japan" 卒業してから、働いている "I've been working since graduating"

children.heading: Specific Time Period
children.content: 日本に来てから、2年になる "It's been 2 years since I came to Japan" 結婚してから、5年経った "5 years have passed since getting married" 始めてから、3ヶ月です "It's been 3 months since starting"

children.heading: まだ〜ない (haven't yet)
children.content: 朝ごはんを食べてから、まだ何も食べていない "Haven't eaten anything since breakfast" 会ってから、まだ連絡していない "Haven't contacted (them) since we met"

children.heading: 〜てからでないと (if not after doing)
children.content:
Must do first action before second.

勉強してからでないと、遊べない "Can't play if not after studying / Must study before playing" 許可をもらってからでないと、できません "Can't do it without getting permission first"

children.heading: 〜てからにする (do after)
children.content:
Postpone second action until after first.

昼ごはんを食べてからにしましょう "Let's do it after eating lunch" 考えてからにします "I'll do it after thinking about it"

children.heading: 〜てからずっと (ever since)
children.content:
Continuous state since first action.

日本に来てからずっと忙しい "I've been busy ever since coming to Japan" 会ってからずっと友達だ "We've been friends ever since we met"

children.heading: 〜てから vs 〜た後で
children.content:
Both mean "after," but slightly different usage:

てから: More conversational, emphasizes sequence 食べてから行く "go after eating" た後で: More formal, broader usage 食べた後で行く "go after eating"

children.heading: 〜てから vs 〜て
children.content: てから: After completing first action 食べてから寝る "sleep after eating" (finished eating) て: Sequential but can overlap 食べて寝る "eat and sleep" (simple sequence)

children.heading: Daily Actions
children.content: 食べてから - after eating 飲んでから - after drinking 見てから - after seeing/watching 読んでから - after reading 書いてから - after writing

children.heading: Transitional Actions
children.content: 帰ってから - after returning/going home 来てから - since coming 着いてから - after arriving 出てから - after leaving 卒業してから - since graduating

children.heading: Preparation Actions
children.content: 準備してから - after preparing 確認してから - after checking 考えてから - after thinking 相談してから - after consulting

children.heading: Example 1: Making Plans
children.content: A: いつ出発する？ "When shall we leave?" B: 昼ごはんを食べてから出発しよう "Let's leave after eating lunch" A: いいね。何食べる？ "Good idea. What shall we eat?"

children.heading: Example 2: Daily Routine
children.content: A: 毎日何時に寝る？ "What time do you sleep every day?" B: シャワーを浴びてから、11時頃寝ます "After taking a shower, I sleep around 11" A: 早いね "That's early"

children.heading: Example 3: Past Experience
children.content: A: 日本に来てから、どのくらい？ "How long since you came to Japan?" B: 2年になります "It's been 2 years" A: 日本語上手になったね "Your Japanese has improved"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using with non-actions
children.content: Wrong: きれいてから ❌ Right: きれいになってから ✓ "after becoming beautiful"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Confusing with から (because)
children.content: から alone: because 忙しいから行けない "Can't go because I'm busy" てから: after 仕事をしてから行く "Go after working"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Wrong tense in first clause
children.content: Less natural: 食べたてから ❌ Natural: 食べてから ✓ "after eating"

children.heading: それから (and then / after that)
children.content:
Not the same as てから, but related concept.

てから: after (completing action) 食べてから寝た "slept after eating" それから: and then (next in sequence) 食べた。それから寝た。 "I ate. And then I slept."

children.heading: 〜てからというもの (ever since)
children.content:
Emphasizes continuous state.

日本に来てからというもの、忙しい "Ever since coming to Japan, I've been busy" 会ってからというもの、毎日考えている "Ever since meeting, I think about (them) every day"

children.heading: 〜ないでから is incorrect
children.content:
Use 〜ないで or 〜ずに instead.

Wrong: 食べないでから寝た ❌ Right: 食べないで寝た ✓ Or: 食べずに寝た ✓ "slept without eating"

children.heading: 〜てから + time + になる/経つ
children.content: 始めてから3年になる "It's been 3 years since starting" 会ってから1ヶ月経った "1 month has passed since we met" 日本に来てから半年です "It's been half a year since I came to Japan"

children.heading: Casual
children.content: 食べてから行く "I'll go after eating" 見てから決める "I'll decide after seeing"

children.heading: Polite
children.content: 食べてから行きます "I'll go after eating" 見てから決めます "I'll decide after seeing"

children.heading: Basic Sequence
children.content: 宿題をしてから、遊びます "I'll play after doing homework" 手を洗ってから、食べてください "Please eat after washing your hands" よく考えてから、答えます "I'll answer after thinking carefully" 映画を見てから、帰ります "I'll go home after watching the movie"

children.heading: Time Duration
children.content: 日本に来てから、2年になります "It's been 2 years since I came to Japan" 結婚してから、5年経った "5 years have passed since getting married" 会ってから、3ヶ月です "It's been 3 months since we met"

children.heading: Daily Routines
children.content: 朝ごはんを食べてから、学校に行く "I go to school after eating breakfast" シャワーを浴びてから、寝る "I sleep after taking a shower" 歯を磨いてから、寝ます "I sleep after brushing my teeth"

children.heading: Past Actions
children.content: 映画を見てから、レストランに行った "After watching a movie, we went to a restaurant" 日本語を勉強してから、日本に来た "I came to Japan after studying Japanese" 相談してから、決めました "I decided after consulting"

children.heading: Postponement Expressions
children.content: 明日にしてからにしましょう "Let's do it after tomorrow / Let's wait until tomorrow" 考えてからにします "I'll do it after thinking" 確認してからにしてください "Please do it after checking"

children.heading: Continuous State Since
children.content: 日本に来てからずっと忙しい "I've been busy ever since coming to Japan" 会ってからずっと友達です "We've been friends ever since we met" 始めてからずっと楽しい "It's been fun ever since starting"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: Te-form Conjugation - Basic te-form 〜た後で (ato de) - After doing (formal) 〜前に (mae ni) - Before doing Before/After (前、後) - Time expressions Sequential Actions - Ordering events Time & Tense - Time expressions
